channel.title: Aquatic on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in Aquatic on ZooBerry

item.title: Valentine Pack
item.description: A Valentine-themed pack featuring paths, balloons, a gazebo, animals, and more.

item.title: Eurasian Beaver
item.description: A European cousin of the American Beaver.

item.title: Northern River Otter
item.description: A cute North American otter for your zoo.

item.title: Cardinal Tetra
item.description: A small tetra fish from the Amazon.

item.title: Powder-Blue Tang
item.description: A beautiful fish that eats algae.

item.title: Sargassum
item.description: The first plant for the pelagic biome.

item.title: Dall's Porpoise
item.description: A detailed and fun-to-watch Dall’s Porpoise for your zoo.

item.title: Whitetip Reef Shark
item.description: Two variations of the Whitetip Reef Shark, with different markings.

item.title: Adelie Penguin
item.description: A recolor of the Adelie Penguin by Electric Eel with help from SilesianTomcat and APE II.

item.title: Chinstrap Penguin
item.description: This penguin lives in the sub-Antarctic islands. Coded by Penguinman with skins by Electric Eel.

item.title: Caribbean Flamingo
item.description: The brightest Caribbean flamingos, showing true red, pink, or orange colors on their legs, bills, and faces.

item.title: Lemon Shark
item.description: The Lemon Shark features two variations, with the darker variation as the default skin. Requires MM2 to use.

item.title: King Penguin
item.description: A large penguin species with fixed alphabetical issues and fame stars in the mod.

item.title: Ichthyosaurus
item.description: The ICHTHYOSAURUS is a marine lizard from Early Jurassic era. It almost resembles a dolphin but the tail is vertical and it has a big sclerotic ring around its eyes.

item.title: Endless Ocean: Luminous
item.description: A pack containing a plethora of aquatic animals created by Buffzoo, majorgalah, and gamevideosforlife.

item.title: Ray Pack
item.description: A collection of stingrays for your marine parks.

item.title: Alpine Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Desert Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Cannonball Jellyfish
item.description: The cannonball jellyfish, also known as the cabbagehead jellyfish, is a species of jellyfish in the family Stomolophidae.

item.title: Cross Jellyfish
item.description: This jelly is commonly seen in Monterey Bay during spring and summer, sometimes in large groups.

item.title: Flower Hat Jellyfish
item.description: This striking and rare jelly has brilliant, multicolored tentacles trailing from a translucent, pinstriped bell.

item.title: Fried Egg Jellyfish
item.description: This jellyfish resembles a fried egg when seen from above.

item.title: Granrojo
item.description: In photographs, it looks like a big red spaceship cruising the ocean depths.

item.title: Lion's Mane Jellyfish
item.description: The lion’s mane jellyfish can be found in the cooler regions of the Atlantic, Pacific, North Sea and Baltic.

item.title: Mauve Stinger
item.description: This species of jellyfish, commonly known as mauve stinger, is widely distributed in all warm and temperate waters.

item.title: Purple-Striped Jellyfish
item.description: Of all the gelatinous creatures visiting Monterey Bay, the purple-striped jelly is certainly among the most recognizable and spectacular.

item.title: Dugong
item.description: The dugong (sometimes refered to as a sea cow) is a mammal- that is, it suckles its young.

item.title: Lesser Flamingo
item.description: The lesser flamingo is herbivorous, feeding solely on a blue-green algae growing within a very limited range of pH.

item.title: Caribbean Reef Squid
item.description: The Caribbean reef squid is found throughout the Caribbean Sea as well as off the coast of Florida.

item.title: Ribbon Eel
item.description: Ribbon eels are aptly named for their delicate movements, as they swim like a slender ribbon dancing in the water column.

item.title: Common Dolphin
item.description: Common dolphins can be found throughout the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.

item.title: Hexaprotodon Pack
item.description: Three extinct hippopotamids from the genus Hexaprotodon.

item.title: Rainbow Hippos
item.description: An adorable pygmy hippo for every color of the rainbow!

item.title: Rainbow Hippos Part 2: NOT Rainbow Hippos
item.description: What comes after the colors of the rainbow? The colors of the not rainbow apparently.

item.title: Bream
item.description: A freshwater fish from various types of waterways in Europe.

item.title: Yellow Stingray
item.description: A small reef-dwelling stingray.

item.title: Koi Carp
item.description: A domesticated cyprinid known for their wide range of color morphs.

item.title: Tiger Shark
item.description: A species of requiem shark and the only member of the genus Galeocerdo.

item.title: Shark Pack 2
item.description: Includes 6 new sharks.

item.title: Shark Pack 1
item.description: Includes 4 sharks.

item.title: Nutria
item.description: A large rodent!
